Budget

When you created DEBTS or SAVINGS accounts, MYnance automatically creates linked income and expenses categories in your BUDGET. In order to preserve linked data properly, you can only delete these items by deleting the parent accounts in either DEBTS or SAVINGS.
Simply use the PLUS buttons to add income categories (all your sources of incoming money) and expenses categories (all the things you spend your money on).
You make a budget for 2 reasons:
1. To make sure you are not spending more money than you earn.
2. To give you spending guidelines for optional items like gifts, entertainment, clothing, etc.
MYnance will alert you if your budget does not balance (i.e. if you are spending more money than you earn).
A realistic budget captures all the major areas of your spending, without getting too bogged down in details.
For example, you could create a category for \"kids\' lessons\", as opposed to 3 separate categories for \"Tommy\'s hockey\", \"Trina\'s dance\", and \"swimming lessons\".

\"Optional\" expenses categories are not necessary in order to use this app, however including them in your BUDGET will give you valuable spending guidelines in your daily life. For example, you will learn how often you can afford to spend money on entertainment or how much money you can afford to spend on gifts.
Payments made to DEBTS and SAVINGS will be added to your budget automatically and treated as needs, so that the money will be \'reserved\' in your bank account.
You should also adjust your budget any time a major change occurs (i.e. you get a raise at work or the amount of a payment changes).
You should review and update your budget at least once a year.
You can use the SPENDING REPORT as a guideline when updating your budget. Running a spending report for an entire year will show you how much you actually spent in each category.

Updating your budget will not adjust your bank account balances retroactively. The app will simply adjust the percentage of future entries to \'reserve\' for needs in accordance with the changes made to the budget.
WARNING: Your budget doesn\'t balance. Please go to the BUDGET screen to fix it.

Continue anyway?
NOTE: Your account balances will not be affected until you pay this item in the \'Pay CC\' tab.
Credit card
Use this tab to record any purchases made against credit cards or lines of credit.
For each purchase, you will select an expense item in your BUDGET, such as \'insurance\' or \'entertainment. You will also select which DEBTS item to map the purchase against.
The DEBTS item\'s balance owing will be updated accordingly.
NOTE: Be careful about mapping a purchase to the same BUDGET and DEBTS item.
It is possible to use a DEBTS item as the selected budget item. For example, if you took money from a credit card to pay down a line of credit.

In that case, the amount of the payment would be added to the balance owing on the credit card and subtracted from the balance owing on the line of credit. If you mapped to the same item twice, the balance owing on the DEBTS item would not update correctly.
MYnance wants to help you develop healthy spending habits. It will alert you if you are making purchases against your DEBTS items when you don\'t have the funds in your account to cover them.
Although purchases entered in this tab will have no effect on your \'total\' and \'available to spend\' balances, you should still avoid accumulating consumer debt.

Payments to your DEBTS items should be made in the PAY CC tab. Your \'total\' and \'available to spend\' balances will change when payments are made in the PAY CC tab and the DEBTS item\'s balance owing will be updated accordingly.
However, purchases recorded in this tab will show up in your SPENDING REPORT as having been spent on the date the entry was made.
Current balance:
Daily Money
\"Total in Account\" is the total amount of money in your bank account. A percentage of this money is reserved for paying \"needs\", as identified by you in your BUDGET.
\"Available to Spend\" is the amount of money that you can spend on \"optional\" expenses, as identified by you in your BUDGET.
Date
Debt
Debts

Enter each of your credit cards, loans, mortgages, lines of credit or other outstanding debts as a separate DEBTS account. They will automatically be added to your BUDGET as \"needs\" and the date that the debt will be paid off will be calculated for you.
The app has calculated that the debt will not be paid off in a reasonable amount of time. Either the interest is too high or the payments are too low or too infrequent.
Simply click on the pencil icon next to the account in the DEBTS screen and enter the new interest rate. A new debt-free date will calculated.

When you created the DEBTS account, a linked income category was created for you in your BUDGET. Simply click on the pencil icon next to it on the BUDGET screen and enter the amount of income that you plan on taking from the DEBTS account. A new debt-free date will be calculated accordingly.

Create an expenses category in your BUDGET called \"interest\" (or something similar). Use the DAILY MONEY - CREDIT CARD tab to create entries against that category (in the 1st pull-down menu), charged against the DEBTS account (in the 2nd pull-down menu).

If you take a cash advance off a DEBTS item, you can enter the transaction in the DAILY MONEY - MONEY IN tab. You bank account balances will be adjusted accordingly. DON\'T FORGET that only a percentage of that deposit will be \'available to spend\'.
If you take frequent cash advances off DEBTS items, you should adjust your BUDGET to reflect this income.
NOTE: If you create an INCOME from a DEBT, the \'debt-free\' date for it will be adjusted accordingly. This change will be reflected in the DEBTS screen.
Purchases against and payments to your debts in the DAILY MONEY tabs will be automatically added or subtracted to the balances owing in the DEBTS screen.

Money In
This app is smart! When you overspend, it won\'t make money \"Available to Spend\" until you\'ve caught up on having enough money reserved for paying the \"needs\" you\'ve identified in your BUDGET.
Each entry will map to an income item in your BUDGET.
When you created your budget, you identified which expense items were for needs and which were for optional spending.
The appropriate percentage of each MONEY IN entry will be reserved for needs according to these BUDGET entries. The remainder will be allotted to the \'available to spend\' amount.
Money Out
Use this tab to record any CASH that comes out of your bank account, either as a cheque, cash withdrawal, or debit card purchase.

NOTE: It is up to you whether you create \'cash withdrawal\' as an expense item in your budget and track withdrawals as one item or whether you account for cash withdrawals as a breakdown of what the money was used for (i.e. $20 withdrawal entered as $10 towards \'entertainment\' and $10 towards \'miscellaneous\').
JUST BE SURE that each cash withdrawal is only entered once in MONEY OUT, otherwise too much money will be taken out of your \'total\' and \'available to spend\' balances.
Purchases made on a credit card must be entered in the CREDIT CARD tab so that the credit card\'s DEBTS record will be updated accordingly.
You can view a summary of your MONEY OUT items in the SPENDING REPORT screen.
Use this tab to record all the transactions when you use your credit cards.
Once a month (12 times/yr)
MYnance will show you how much money in your bank account is actually available to spend at any given time

MYnance is a great tool to help you make sure you avoid consumer debt. Use this tab to manage money owing on DEBTS items resulting from purchases.
Enter any purchases you make on credit cards or lines of credit in the CREDIT CARD tab and make frequent payments to them using the PAY CC tab.
If you want to make additional payments to your DEBTS items that don\'t map to particular purchases, you can enter those transactions in the DAILY MONEY - MONEY OUT tab.
MYnance will alert you if you are trying to make a payment when you don\'t have the funds available in your \'total\' or \'available to spend\' balances.
Pay these amounts to your credit cards:
You don\'t have enough money in your account to make this purchase. You will put your balance into the negative.
You don\'t have enough spending money left in your account to make this purchase. You will be spending money that is reserved for other expenses.
Press the PLUS button above to add a debt.
Press the PLUS button above to add savings.

Savings

Enter each of your savings and investment accounts as a separate SAVINGS account. They will automatically be added to your BUDGET as \"needs\" and the date that the savings goal will be achieved will be calculated for you.
The app has calculated that the savings goal will not be achieved in a reasonable amount of time. Either the interest is too low or the contributions are too low or too infrequent.
Simply click on the pencil icon next to the account in the SAVINGS screen and enter the new interest rate. A new \"goal achieved\" date will calculated.

When you created the SAVINGS account, a linked income category was created for you in your BUDGET. Simply click on the pencil icon next to it on the BUDGET screen and enter the amount of income that you plan on taking from the SAVINGS account. A new \"goal achieved\" date will be calculated accordingly.
Simply change the \"goal\" amount and a new \"goal achieved\" date will be calculated. Change the amount accordingly until the date is closest to your certain date.

NOTE: If you create an INCOME from a SAVINGS item, the amount of the contributions to it will be adjusted accordingly, as will the \'goal achieved\' date for it. These changes will be reflected in the SAVINGS screen.
Payments towards and withdrawals from your savings items in the DAILY MONEY tabs will be automatically added to or subtracted from the balances in the SAVINGS screen.
This savings info has been saved to your BUDGET

Set Up
The automatic set up process walked you through setting up your debts, savings, and budget.
All of these items can be changed manually by using the MENU to access their screens.
You also entered a starting balance for your bank account. This amount can be changed by clicking on the pencil icon next to it in the DAILY MONEY - MONEY IN tab.
You can adjust the amount in your bank account by making entries in the DAILY MONEY screen.

Manage your money and keep on top of your debt in just a few steps
Welcome to MYnance!
Simply follow along with the guided set up process
Step 1:
Go to \'Daily Money\' to make income and spending entries, track your credit card transactions, and watch your weekly spending limits
Step 2:
MYnance will let you know how much money in your bank account is actually available for spending at any given time
MYnance will help you keep on top of your credit card spending so you avoid getting into consumer debt
Visit the \'Help\' section if you need more guidance
Spending Report
MYnance will show you your spending in each expense category of your budget by month or for the year to date.
Simply use the pull-down menus to choose the period of time that you\'d like to see.
When updating your budget, you can use the year to date spending report to see what your actual spending was in each category and use those numbers as the new budget amounts.

Weekly (52 times/yr)
Weekly Limits
When you create expense items in your BUDGET and identify them as \'optional\', you will be given the choice whether or not to manage their weekly spending limits.
You can change this setting for any expense item at any time in the BUDGET screen by clicking on the pencil icon next to the item.
MYnance will break the yearly amount for the item down to a weekly limit and track how much is left each week to spend on the item.
Mark budget expense items as \'optional\' and you will then be asked whether or not you would like to track their spending on a weekly basis.
WEEKLY LIMIT EXCEEDED
Weekly limits are set up in the BUDGET screen.
No: This is an occasional expense and I don\'t need weekly guidance
Yes: I spend on this frequently and would like to be reminded of my limits
Do you want this category added to the WEEKLY LIMITS tab to help you stay within your spending limits?
On which DEBT?
Once a year (1 time/yr)
Entire year to date

Go to the DAILY MONEY - MONEY IN tab and click on the pencil icon next to the starting balance.

What does \"Total in Account\" mean?
What does \"Available to Spend\" mean?
Money In Tab
Money Out Tab
Credit Card Tab
Pay CC Tab
Weekly Limits Tab
I put money into my account, but the \"Available to Spend\" amount is still zero.
It seems like the wrong amount is going into the \"Available to Spend\" amount.

The app will reserve the percentage of any money you put into your bank account that you identified in your BUDGET as being needed to pay for \"needs\". Only the balance of your income will be \"Available to Spend\".
The DAILY MONEY - MONEY IN tab only allows me to put money into my bank account. Where do I go to put money into my other accounts?
Any other accounts you have can be set up as DEBTS or SAVINGS.
To transfer money from your bank account to another account, use the DAILY MONEY - MONEY OUT tab. Use the pull-down menu to choose the account where you want the money to go.

To transfer funds from a DEBTS account to another account, use the DAILY MONEY - CREDIT CARD tab. Use the pull-down menu to choose the account where you want the money to go and use the 2nd pull-down menu to choose which DEBTS account the money should come from.

To transfer funds from a SAVINGS account to another account, use the DAILY MONEY - MONEY IN tab to transfer the money from the SAVINGS account to your bank account. Then, use the DAILY MONEY - MONEY OUT tab to transfer the same amount into the appropriate account.
When I take a cash withdrawal from my bank account, how can I record what I spend the money on?
How you handle cash withdrawals is a personal choice.

You can create a \"cash withdrawal\" expenses category in your BUDGET and record the transaction once against it, or you can choose to record where every dollar of the cash withdrawal was spent against several expenses categories.

MYnance believes the 2nd method will become tedious and is an unrealistic way to manage your money. It should suffice to record the cash withdrawal as a whole. You can use the SPENDING REPORT to identify if frequent cash withdrawals are a problem area for you.
What is the difference between using the DAILY MONEY - PAY CC tab or the DAILY MONEY - MONEY OUT tab to record a payment to my credit card?
MYnance believes strongly in avoiding consumer debt on credit cards. The DAILY MONEY - PAY CC tab is built specifically for this purpose.

Using this tab once a week or more to make frequent payments to your credit card will ensure that you never pay interest on those purchases, but you will still earn the rewards that your credit card offers!
You can also make additional payments that don\'t map to specific purchases by using the DAILY MONEY - MONEY OUT tab.
Why does MYnance give me spending warnings when I\'m using my credit card?
MYnance believes that blind spending on credit cards leads to consumer debt. That is why we will alert you if you don\'t have the funds to cover your credit card purchases.
What are weekly limits and how can I set them up?

When you identify an expense category in your BUDGET as \"optional\", the app will ask you if you\'d like to track your spending on a weekly basis. If yes, you can use the DAILY MONEY - WEEKLY LIMITS tab to see how much has been spent between Monday and Sunday of this week against that category.
Why am I unable to delete some of the items in the DAILY MONEY - CREDIT CARD tab?
Once you\'ve made a payment to a credit card against a particular purchase, that purchase can no longer be deleted.
Why can\'t I delete certain income or expenses categories?
I need guidance to make a budget.

I need guidance to enter debts accounts.
Why does the date come up as \"Too far in the future\"?
What if the interest rate changes on my DEBTS account?

How can I record the interest I get charged on my DEBTS accounts?
I need guidance to enter savings accounts.
What if the interest rate changes in my SAVINGS account?
I frequently take cash withdrawals from a SAVINGS account, how should I get the app to handle this?
I don\'t have a particular financial goal I\'m trying to achieve, I want to know how much I\'ll accumulate by a certain date.
